summary: "Seadog Armor" is a semi-lore friendly, stand alone, light armor set for all races and both genders. Seadogs are both criminals and masters of the sea. If you enjoy ale, a good bar fight, and a wench or two, this set is for you.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Ye9b5.png[/img][/center]
[center]An armor mod by Hothtrooper44.[/center]
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/xPGf0.png[/img][/center]
Rarely seen on dry land, seadogs are the lifeblood of port towns in Skyrim and all across Tamriel. While at sea they are the bane of small merchant ships, bringing terror and misfortune to honest citizens of the empire. Many are criminals attempting to escape the law by disappearing into the eternal swell of the sea, and often entire ships of convicts can be found raiding small islands and cargo ships far beyond the reach of the Imperial Legion. While on land they spend most of their time in taverns drinking ale, eating heartily, and consorting with wenches. Criminal or no, they’re always welcome in port as they bring much needed supplies, their appetites are many, and their coin is good.

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/JyaPl.png[/img][/center]
"Seadog Armor" is a semi-lore friendly, stand alone, light armor set for all races and both genders. Seadogs are both criminals and masters of the sea. If you enjoy ale, a good bar fight, and a wench or two, this set is for you.

This set has similar statistics to glass armor, and thus requires the glass smithing perk to craft. The items will be found under the studded leather section of the forge. The set comes with armor/boots/gloves(or an armor variant with no flintlock pistols attached) in addition to two tricorn hat options(one with plumes and one without) an eye patch, a cape, a pirate like cutlass, and golden hoop earrings.

The armor is adorned with a bottle of rum, black-powder flintlocks, sword-side armor plating and more.

If you want to wield a flintlock in combat, [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8533]grab one from here[/url].

[center][youtube]ZVJLQGNvcfI[/youtube]

Feedback on the armor should be left in the comments section. I will read all the comments made and consider requests for alterations and potential fixes.

** If you like it, endorse it! **[/center]

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/oGfco.png[/img][/center]
I would like to take this small space to thank the users of my mods, and the Nexus community at large. I am honored to be a part of this community, and to contribute to it. Thank you for your patronage of my work, whether it comes through comments, endorsements, or even a kind donation. You are the reason that I spend long hours of work bettering Skyrim. The Nexus community is the reason I continue to create mods. Thank you.

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/yqSdJ.png[/img][/center]
If you wish to use this armor set for your mod, please ask me by message first.
I do wish to help other mods and the community at large with my work, so don't hold back from asking!

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5vNtT.png[/img][/center]
hothtrooper44 – Seadog Armor
Bethesda for Skyrim and its assets
Mr. Dave for inspiration and help with the pirate hat!
omesean for rigging the flintlocks to the armor as well as the rum bottle that was adapted from the Einherjar armor set of his
Ceekay9 for his amazing eye patch mesh!
humannature66 for the fantastic hoop earrings
miklou for the mesh and textures for the flintlock pistols
stenar1000 for a couple of the screenshots posted
Edg3k for help with the lore
